Variable: Biogas Recovery Factor at LSMM Anaerobic Digesters
Fraction of Nitrogen Used in Fertilizer
Information:
| This scalar represents the fraction of total volatile solids (manure) available for fertilizer. Some categories, like ``deep_bedding`` are often combined with others. To avoid mutli-stage management, entries for these categories should specify a fraction of manure that will eventually end up used in fertilizer.
 | 
 | **NOTE:** Incineration is included since urine is separated and sent to fertilizer. The fraction that is sent to fertilizer is applied only to nitrogen in urine.

| Represents :math:`N_{beddingMS_{(T, S)}}` in Equation 10.34 in V4, C10 IPCC GNGHGI 2019R, or the amount of nitrogen from bedding. 
 | 
 | Applies only to solid storage and deep bedding.
Notes: See V4, C10 (2019R) 10.95 for a description of default values.

Information: Factor applied to mass of dung used in anaerobic digesters to estimate relative mass of nitrogen.
See :math:`R_{N_2(N_2O)}` in Equation 10.34B, V4,C10 IPCC GNGHGI 2019R

Variable: LSMM Biogas Recovered from Anaerobic Digesters

Information: Managed manure that is not used for fertilizer can be used for construction, feed, or left at point of use. This gives the amount used for these totals.

Variable: Total Nitrogen Available for Fertilizer from Dung
Total Nitrogen Available for Fertilizer from Urine

Information: Deposits from the ``pasture_paddock_range`` category are treated in the Soil Management subsector. This variable is used to pass total nitrogen deposits to the soil management subsector model.
